properties.name: Al's Star Cycle & Sports
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   416.249.0676

properties.name: All Wheels N' Motion
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  416.536.2604

properties.name: Alternative Grounds
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  333 Roncesvalles Avenue Toronto, Ontario CanadaWarm, comfortable cafe in Roncesvalles. Fair Trade coffee, freshly roasted, imported and marketed by Alternative Grounds. Nice patio in the back.

properties.name: Bathurst Cycle
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  416.533.7510

properties.name: Bayview Cycle Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  416.533.7510

properties.name: Biseagal
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  Small bike store specializing in building customizing bikes: frame preparation, wheel building, steel frame brazing, and more.

properties.name: City Hall
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli100 Queen St. West, Toronto, ONWhere the mayor and councillors meet and have offices. Lots of neat events and protests take place in front at Nathan Phillips Square. It also happens to be a Bikeshare hub

properties.name: Community Bicycle Network
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  761 Queen Street West, Toronto, ON, CanadaBicycle network for the downtown Toronto community. A hub for Bikeshare bikes, and community workshops like Wenches with Wrenches and Toolworks.

properties.name: Crother's Woods
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  The best mountain biking area accessible from downtown Toronto. Many hardcore cyclists have enjoyed this urban green jewel. There are a lot of technical trails hidden away in the trees. The area is also being managed as one of the few remaining Carolinean forests in Southern Ontario so be nice to the trees! I\'ll leave it up to you to find the entrances to the trails.

properties.name: Cycle Solutions - Beaches
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   615 Kingston Rd, toronto416-691-0019

properties.name: Cycle Therapy
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 1223 Dundas St, torontoNew community bike store on the new Dundas East bike lanes (at Carlaw). They have great workshops for beginning cyclists and also have a Bikeshare hub. They also have bike trailers for rent.

properties.name: Dave Fix My Bike
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  416.944.2453

properties.name: Dufflet Pastries (Queen)
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 787 Queen Street West, TorontoLittle pastry and coffee shop. Mmmmm... yummy pastries.

properties.name: Dukes Sports
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   416.233.2011

properties.name: Fastest Hill in Toronto
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli You can go really fast downhill on this hill. I think it\'s even faster than the Eglinton/Leslie hill, but I may be wrong. I can\'t remember if there are lights at the bottom - always a major bummer for a cyclist. A big waste of potential energy! For the environment, please take out all stop signs and lights at the bottom of hills!!

properties.name: Future Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   483 Bloor W, torontoVery popular cafe with hipsters and students.. I don\'t think they bake bread anymore, but I might be wrong.

properties.name: Global Village Backpackers
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  460 King Street West TorontoJust voted best hostel in Toronto\'s Eye Magazine (January 2006). I haven\'t stayed there but it looks like a good place. It seems like the name is a nod to McLuhan.

properties.name: Grapefruit Moon
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 968 Bathurst Street, Toronto, ONFunky little neighbourhood diner serves some amazing fries, vegetarian choices, and fresh juices.

properties.name: Grassroots Annex
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  408 Bloor Street West, Toronto, ONEnvironmental products store in the Annex. Find anything from energy efficient lightbulbs to funky hemp clothes to recycled cards and notebooks.

properties.name: Grassroots Riverdale
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 372 Danforth Avenue, torontoEnvironmental products store, also have a store near Bloor and Spadina. They have a Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Harbourfront Community Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 627 Queens Quay West, torontoCommunity centre at the harbourfront. Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Highland Creek Trail
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli You can take the Highland Creek all the way from the Scarborough Civic Centre to Lake Ontario. It weaves a bit and you have to get around the golf course. The trail going down to the beach is a beautiful sight.

properties.name: Hostelling International - Toronto
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  76 Church Street TorontoAffordable hostel with accreditation from Hostelling International - always a good sign.

properties.name: Jet Fuel
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  519 Parliament St, torontoFunky coffee shop packed with Cabbagetown locals and hardcore cyclists. Sponsers Jet Fuel Cycling Team. Coffee and only coffee. They have a Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Linux Caffe
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  326 Harbord Street, TorontoGreat coffee (courtesy of Ideal Coffee), great company and wireless. Linux enthusiasts offering their place for geek meetups. Food\'s good too with veggie options.

properties.name: Lower Don Multi-use Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  A cycling, walking, rollerblading and wheelchairing bridge that crosses the Lower Don River. It\'s only a few years old but it has greatly enhanced the cycle commuting for east Toronto. There is also a new trail that continues on the north and south sides of Lakeshore Boulevard all the way to Coxwell/Ashbridges Bay Park.

properties.name: Masaryk-Cowan Community Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 220 Cowan Avenue, torontoCommunity centre in the heart of Parkdale, accessible to disadvantaged people. Games room, activities, library next door. Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Moonbean Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   30 St. Andrew Street, Toronto, ONVery popular cafe in funky Kensington Market. Always packed. Freshly roasted Fair Trade coffee.

properties.name: OPIRG - University of Toronto
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 563 Spadina Ave, torontoOntario Public Interest Research Group at University of Toronto. Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: SAC, University of Toronto
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli12 Hart House Circle, Toronto, ONStudent Administrative Council at University of Toronto. They are also a Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Scadding Court Community Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   707 Dundas St. W., torontoCommunity centre with a pool and public library, close to Kensington Market (Dundas and Bathurst). Many activities like dance classes, gymnastics, even fishing in the summer! They have a Bikeshare hub.

properties.name: Set Me Free
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   Small community bike store with custom built commuter bikes for sale.

properties.name: Shortcut across the tracks
properties.description: Posted by NubeliFor those crazy enough to attempt to cycle up to North York, or York University, here is a somewhat nice route up Caledonia to its end, and then go west on Bridgeland Avenue until you get to the tracks. There should be a hole in the tracks so you get across to Keele and then over the 401. The other option is to go under the bridge and there should be another hole on the other side. Note: It is illegal to trespass onto the railway property so don\'t do it!

properties.name: The 519 Church Street Community Centre
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 519 Church Street, torontoLots of programming, especially geared towards the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered communities. They have a Bikeshare hub. 416-392-6874

properties.name: The Bike Joint
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli 290 1/2 Harbord Street, Toronto, ONSmall but friendly neighbourhood bike store, owned by Derek Chadbourne

properties.name: Toronto Islands
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli  The very popular islands just off of downtown Toronto. Great walking and cycling. Hosts a children\'s park and playground, plus year-round, carfree residences.

properties.name: Trudeau Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli An elegant cycling, walking, rollerblading and wheelchairing bridge spanning the Humber River. It is a very popular spot for Toronto locals to get some cool summer breezes and get some exercise along the Martin Goodman Trail, right next to Lake Ontario.

properties.name: Urbane Cyclist
properties.description: Posted by Nubeli   180 John St. Toronto, Ontario M5T 1X5 Canada TEL: (416) 979-9733 The best and friendliest cyclist commuter bike shop in Toronto! They also sell custom built commuter, racing and courier bicycles.
